newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: TENNIS-TOP SEED KAFELNIKOV CRASHES OUT OF CZECH OPEN.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-TOP SEED KAFELNIKOV CRASHES OUT OF CZECH OPEN.

text.p: Top seed Yevegeny Kafelnikov crashed out of the $365,000 Czech Open men's ATP tennis tournament on Thursday, losing in straight sets to unseeded German qualifier Marcello Craca 7-6 6-4.

Second seed Marcelo Rios continued his recent run of form, cruising past France's Stephan Simian 6-4 6-2 in another second round match, while Fabrice Santoro was the first to reach the semifinals, taking out Brazil's Gustavo Kurten 7-6 3-6 6-1.

In each set Kafelnikov, the returning champion and world number four, started well with early breaks but failed to capitalise and was undone by a slew of unforced errors that allowed Craca back into the match.
It was the the third consecutive week the 23-year-old Russian has lost in an early round of an ATP event.
"I had the first set under control, but somehow I just lost it," last year's French Open champion said afterwards.
Chilean Rios, coming off his biggest tournament win at the Monte Carlo Open last week, had little trouble dispatching Kurten in 68 minutes.
"Overall, I am happy with my play today, I really didn't make many errors. It was our first meeting so I didn't really know what to expect," Rios said.
